The south wall of the loft has collapsed, leaving an opening to the desolate street below. A collection of rotting wood figurines lies jumbled in a corner.

node.name: Ratha, Well-Manicured Lawn
node.description: The darkened street surrounds this grassy area. The flowers wait patiently in the dark for the sun's arrival, while the cool grass slowly stands up straight, preparing itself for the feet of the people who will surely be here with the sun.

Flowers line the thick, green grass. A small opening between the flowers provides access to the lawn from the street. A pleasant breeze stirs the flowers, while bees industriously fly from flower to flower. The feel of the grass between one's toes brings people trickling in throughout the day.

node.name: Ratha, Lift
node.description: Various kinds of native and imported wood fill gaps in the lift's floor like a jester's patchwork cloak. This single lift between the working section of Ratha and the merchant district looks to be the most used, and the least maintained.

node.name: Ratha, Jail
node.description: A loose scattering of straw cannot conceal the stinking remains of rotten refuse. By the look of the yellow substance that also stains the floor, someone was not able to handle the smell.

node.name: Truffenyi's Green, Western Fields
node.description: A large common green stretches out over most of the northeastern section of the tier. The grassy area is an excellent spot for athletic activities, for a meal on the soft grass, or contemplating the sky above. Chadatru's temple lies to the south. A narrow path winds under a row of pine trees on the western border of the field.

node.name: Truffenyi's Green
node.description: A large common green stretches out over most of the northeastern section of the tier. The grassy area is an excellent spot for athletic activities, for a meal on the soft grass, or contemplating the sky above. The western edge of the field backs on to the temples of Chadatru and Glythtide, and a fountain dedicated to Truffenyi stands to the east near the intersection of the eastern-most road and East Palace Drive.

node.name: Ratha, East Palace Drive
node.description: In the shadow of the palace, one finds respite from the constant movement of people and horses, carriages and carts in one of many gardens and walkways in and around the various temples.
The great height of the palace looms to the west. During the quiet of the evening hours, one can ponder the great structure in relative peace and safety.

node.name: Ratha, East Palace Drive
node.description: Wide and expansive, this elegant drive parades west toward Regents Circle and the magnificent Ratha Palace beyond. Down the center of the avenue, a tree-lined median channels carriage traffic east and west in an orderly flow. All along the regal boulevard, handsome wrought-iron fencing and sculptured topiaries create a formal garden-like atmosphere, as administrators and clergy mingle with Ratha's upper class citizenry along the wide plazas on either side of the street.

Wide and expansive, this elegant drive parades west toward Regents Circle and the magnificent Ratha Palace beyond. Down the center of the avenue, a lighted median channels carriage traffic east and west in an orderly flow.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: The road forks as it passes near the Temple district. High walls protect the estates and offices of the tax gatherers to the south, and heavily-armed guards stalk along the walls, secure behind stone and iron. The street itself is spotlessly clean, each scale-shaped cobble has been set with consummate skill so that the path resembles the endless coils of some enormous serpent.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: The wide roadway wends between the blessed realms of the temples and the cursed domains of the tax gatherers. Like the proverbial rock and a hard place, one must steer a difficult course between two such powerful entities. To the south, the great lift descends to less heady heights.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: Golden Scale Road leads from the lifts into the elite heart of Ratha. The road is paved with stone blocks cleverly carved to resemble large scales, carefully set with gold-tinted mortar. The effect is one of gaudy elegance. The motif is reflected in the massive pillars that carry the iron chains that control the great lift.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: The Temples of Ratha rise on both sides of this immaculately clean roadway. The sacred architecture of a dozen different sects and cults vie with each other in what could have been a tasteless clash but somehow has managed to blend itself into a curious harmony. Even the varied clouds of incense that drift about manage to combine into a strangely invigorating scent.

node.name: Temple of Hodierna, Grand Hallway
node.description: The high vaulted ceiling towers above, drawing your gaze upward to its gleaming apex. The ceiling itself is made of many fragments of clear and frosted crystals that refract the light, showering the walls and marble floor with tiny rainbowed circles. A detailed statue of a unicorn is the main centerpiece, standing gracefully in the middle of the room. The arch leading into the main shrine is made of the finest ivory with images of Hodierna carved into it.

node.name: Temple of Hodierna, Asketi's Chamber
node.description: There is very little light filtering through here. The walls are made of alternating black and white porcelain tiles, dull and lackluster from years of neglect. A black ebony statue stands next to the doorway, a forboding image of the goddess Asketi. An alabaster carving of a slithering adder seems to wrap around the base of the statue and run along the length of the room.

node.name: Temple of Hodierna, Berengaria's Bridge
node.description: The influence of the Pantel family is evident here. Tapestries dedicated to Berengaria adorn each wall. One depicts the goddess walking through a desolate field dropping seeds to the ground. Another shows her watching over farmers as they harvest their abundant crops. Worshippers of Berengaria have paid tribute to the goddess by offering wheat and other grains at the foot of a statue in the corner.

node.name: Temple of Hodierna, Quiet Room
node.description: The room is barren except for a few comfortable chairs and a lavishly upholstered divan for worshippers to rest their weary feet. There are no windows here, but there is a soft glow coming from some small oil lamps in each corner. A garish portrait of the Pantel family covers the entire wall above the divan. A small group huddles in the corner, whispering and reading prayers amongst themselves.

node.name: Temple of Hodierna, Holy Sanctuary
node.description: The main part of the temple is dedicated to the goddess herself. Entering through the arch, the first thing your eyes rest upon is the wall directly opposite the entrance. An awe-inspiring mural of Hodierna, made out of thousands of tiny colored tiles, covers the entire length of the sanctuary. Each tile is carefully placed, detailing the goddess' features, giving her an almost life-like appearance. The altar is made of a pure white marble and polished to a lustrous shine.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: The dome of Phelim's Temple rises against the sky in a gentle curve that offsets the harshness of this rock-bound city. The air is rich with the sea tang from far below and the sound of sonorous chanting from within the sacred precincts blends with the distant wave song of the open ocean.

node.name: Phelim's Temple, Exterior
node.description: The temple to Phelim is a domed building, made of black stone, that overlooks the eastern cliffs of the island. The sea is visible beyond, where the horizon of ocean stretches far into the distance. A treeless, open sky arches overhead.
The temple to Phelim is a domed building silhouetted against the night sky. The sound of the sea beyond rumbles far below nearby cliffs, and the treeless, expansive sky floats overhead.

node.name: Phelim's Temple, Planetarium
node.description: The domed roof of the temple is closed and the constellations are projected on the ceiling and walls in a splendid display of the heavens. The floor stones are black marble and glisten softly in the dim light, and the dark walls are cool and smooth to the touch.
The domed roof of Phelim's temple is open to the night sky with a large telescope pointed towards the heavens.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: Monks and clerics pass one another with nods or bows or barely concealed glares, depending on the relative state of relations amongst their deities and congregations. Overhead, two grotesque gargoyles, one on each of two otherwise dissimilar buildings, seem to be glaring at each other in mimicry of the unspoken tensions below.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: Tucked snugly in among the high and mighty temples is a quaint and curious shop, from which wafts an inviting tendril of incense that tugs at passersby. Nearby, a lone mystic sits in a curious posture, knees intertwined with legs in what seems an uncomfortable pose. He seems almost asleep until the twitching of one nostril, as it is tickled by the smoke emanating from the shop, shows that some attention to the mundane world exists within that ascetic shell.

node.name: Chabalu's Exotics, Showroom
node.description: The shop looks to be a hodgepodge of many different cultures. Beautiful silk tapestries cover many of the walls, at least the ones not being used to display items. A mind-numbing sweet incense fills the air, making it seem quite natural for someone to empty their pockets of coins.

arc.move: room ask chabalu about cellar;go trap door

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: Despite the general tone of wealth shown by the nearby Temples, the facade of the Clerics' Guild is modest to the point of being shabby. Made of humble materials in a modest state of repairs, it sits alone, taking quiet pride in the essence of those it serves rather from the transience of mundane decoration and frippery.

node.name: Cleric's Guild, Outer Sanctuary
node.description: The simple entry into the Guild is barren except for a few alcoves, each holding a lit candle. Carved along the baked red clay walls are S'kra writings and symbols of the High Priest of Ratha. Spidery cracks run rampant throughout the room, caused from years of neglect.

node.name: Cleric's Guild, Inner Sanctuary
node.description: The inner part of the Guild is a bit more tended to than the outer entrance. A soft snowbeast rug has been crudely stitched together and placed carefully on the floor, spanning the entire room. Oil lamps sit on tables in each corner, giving off a warm glow in this otherwise dark and musty room. An effort has been made to repair the ceiling and walls where water has found a way to seep in. A broken doorway leads out to the gardens.

node.name: Cleric Guild, Garden Retreat
node.description: The gardens are the most cared for part of the guild. Gardenia bushes line the entire perimeter and are in full bloom, giving off a pungent scent that fills the air. A stone fountain carved into the form of a S'kra Mur figure stands in the middle of the yard. An ivy-covered lattice arch leads off towards a shrine while a small path leads off towards the guild leader's retreat.

The scent of gardenias fills the night air. The sound of water trickling from the fountain seems magnified in the darkness. An arch is barely discernible in the shadows caused by the lighted torches that line the path to the guild leader's retreat.

node.name: Tamsine's Shrine, Secluded Arbor
node.description: A quiet area is made up of hundreds of giant redwood and fir trees grouped together allowing just enough light to filter through. The chirping of birds and a trickling stream in the distance are the only sounds that fill the air in this otherwise peaceful place. A small covered gazebo stands at the end of the path with a small shrine dedicated to the goddess Tamsine.

node.name: Tamsine's Shrine, Inside the Gazebo
node.description: A soft breeze flows through the gazebo, bringing with it a fresh scent of flowers. A long wooden bench sits in one corner, a carved statue of the Goddess Tamsine sitting upon it. Offerings of flowers have been placed at her feet.

node.name: Cleric's Guild, Kor'yvyn's Retreat
node.description: A quiet spot off of the garden is where the guild leader Kor'yvyn likes to spend most of his time. The ground is covered entirely in sand that feels soft against the feet. Literally a garden of stone, there are sculpted flowers and plants, as well as a topiary of stone animals. The guild leader himself sits on a sculpture of a majestic king cobra coiled to form a chair.

node.name: Cleric Guild, Stairwell
node.description: The stairwell is dark and uncared for. Some of the steps leading down to the first floor are in such disrepair, one has to skip them to avoid tripping or falling through. A small window that overlooks the gardens provides some light in this otherwise dank stairwell.

node.name: Cleric Guild, The Study
node.description: The room here is very tidy and well kept compared to the rest of the guild. A soft and refreshing scent of lilacs lingers in the air. Books and prayer books sit atop a small desk that is also adorned with holy S'kra icons. A portrait of the High Priest hangs on the wall behind the desk, concealing cracks that have started to spread on the wall.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: The confluence of several disparate roads among the temples has been dubbed the Threefold Path by local wags. The rich decor of the buildings and the many finely garbed holy workers reminds one that the business of serving the gods is oft a profitable endeavor. The presence of the lavish Imperial Palm Inn also gives credence to the relative wealth of the Temples.

node.name: Ratha, Eastern Promenade
node.description: The Oracle Veraclese's Cleric shop stands at this, the eastern end of Promenade Way. More shops and guilds are found to the north on Three Fold Path along with an Inn which eagerly awaits the visit of folks in need of sustenance and sleep. Journeying westward, the route borders the banking district and the Palace, and finally leads to the temple district.

node.name: Oracle Veraclese, Divine Rialto
node.description: This quaint shop run by the Oracle Veraclese specializes in items for the holy and the devout. Artifacts and other holy items are placed neatly on shelves made of frosted crystal. The light filtering in through the stained glass windows refracts on the opposite wall into a spectrum of colors forming a rainbow. A saintly looking Gor'tog woman moves about quietly, neatly stacking items on their appropriate shelves.

This quaint shop run by the Oracle Veraclese specializes in items for the holy and the devout. Artifacts and other holy items are placed neatly on shelves made of frosted crystal. A soft glow comes from the candles placed in alcoves on the opposite wall. The stained glass windows look out onto the street, revealing the night sky. A saintly looking Gor'tog woman moves about quietly, neatly stacking items onto their appropriate shelves.

node.name: Divine Rialto, Odds and Ends
node.description: The back room of the Rialto caters to the fashion tastes of all who have money to spend. Knick-knacks and other inexpensive items are sold here, as well as some highly fashionable vestments. Mannequins neatly line the back wall and are adorned with fashions available for immediate purchase.

node.name: Ratha, Eastern Promenade
node.description: Bordered by a plethora of trees and bushes, a short walkway is visible that leads to the verandah of the Empath's Guild. Somehow the dust of the roadway disappears, giving way to a welcome and pleasant spot in which to relax surrounded by the fragrant smells of herbs and potions from both the plants themselves and from their use by the guild members within. One can usually find a kind member of this guild here to tend to any health problems.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Verandah
node.description: A wide verandah with a canopy of honeysuckle and grape vines runs the full length of the building. Colorful mosaics celebrating the healing arts cover the walls. Above the doorway leading into the building, the greeting Welcome to the Empath Guild of Ratha is formed in blue and gold-colored tiles.

A wide verandah with a canopy of honeysuckle and grape vines runs the full length of the building. Above the doorway leading into the building, the greeting Welcome to the Empath Guild of Ratha is formed in blue and gold-colored tiles. Overhead, a candle-lit chandelier casts a warm, welcoming glow.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, East Verandah
node.description: The sweet scent of honeysuckle fills the eastern end of the verandah. Hummingbirds dart in and out sampling the nectar of crimson and yellow flowers growing the trellises around the outer edge. Mounds of colorful canvas cushions have been set out as seating. The light that filters through is barely enough to view the mosaic.

The sweet scent of flowers fills the eastern end of the verandah. A candle-lit brass chandelier casts a warm glow illuminating the mosaic on the inner wall. Mounds of colorful canvas cushions have been set out as seating.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, West Verandah
node.description: Lush vines laden with grapes block the sights and sounds of the street outside the guild. Padded benches, tucked into the corners at this end of the verandah, provide comfortable seating for guild visitors. The light that filters through is barely enough to view the mosaic.

Lush vines laden with grapes block the sights and sounds of the street outside the guild. Padded benches, tucked into the corners at this end of the verandah, provide comfortable seating for guild visitors. A candle-lit chandelier illuminates the room.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Central Corridor
node.description: The long corridor serves as little more than a passageway to get from room to room and front to back of the guild hall. Except for occasional scuff and gouge marks from careless visitors, the plaster walls are undecorated.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Guild Office
node.description: Sketches and drawings of herbs, flowers, and arcane alchemical equipment cover the walls of the guild office. Bundles of jadice, rosemary, and lavender hang from overhead drying racks. Pots of yelith and miniature roses sit on a bench in front of a window overlooking the garden.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Main Patio
node.description: The crest of the Empaths' Guild has been skillfully recreated in broken tiles to pave the patio at the back of the Guild. Carved limestone benches interspersed with young potted palms line the rim of the circular patio. Behind them, crimson and orange daylilies dance happily in the breeze. To the west beyond a wrought iron gate lies the Guild Leader's herb garden.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Herb Garden
node.description: Although a few of the plants seem to be carefully pruned, most have been allowed to grow freely. Small paths trace through the naturalized herb garden giving limited access to all the plants. A vine covered wrought iron fence surrounds the garden.

Small paths trace through the naturalized herb garden giving limited access to all the plants. The sweet, heady perfume of moonflowers fills the air. Practically invisible during the day, at night they bloom a pale silvery-white on the vine-covered wrought iron fence that surrounds the garden. In the glow from the patio and the guild house windows, only the vague shapes of the other plants can be seen.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Grassy Clearing
node.description: At first glance the clearing appears to be covered with short grass, but each footstep releases citrus and pineapple scents. Lemon thyme and low-growing chamomile have been planted along with the grass to form a slightly springy herbal carpet. Their small yellow and white flowers are strewn among the deep green grass like stars across the sky.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Covered Patio
node.description: Although the framework is complete, only part of the slats for the patio cover have been installed. At the far end of the patio, workmen have carelessly left bundles of the slats and several stacks of tiles uncovered. A young grapevine has been staked and tied to climb one of the outer support posts. In a few years, it may cover the patio and provide shade and shelter, but for now it looks abandoned in a forgotten corner of the guild.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Store Room
node.description: Rows of mostly barren wooden shelves fill the room, the few that are full contain empty jars and glass bottles. Rounds of hard cheese, several braids of onions, and a string of sausages hang from ceiling hooks.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Work Room
node.description: Several long work tables have been pushed against the walls to open up space in the center of the room, where a dozen or so chairs form a loose semi-circle facing the chalkboard on the outer wall. Life-size drawings of the major races are tacked in front covering most of the chalkboard. The remaining board space contains a list of the common body parts.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Library
node.description: Mostly empty shelves line the walls of the Empath Library, but there are multiple copies of the books that are here. Several leather reading chairs and some over-stuffed cloth-covered chairs are scattered about the room, each placed close enough to a window or lamp to give a reader sufficient light.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Meeting Room
node.description: The upper floor of the guild consists of a single large room lined with windows. A motley collection of well-used wooden benches is scattered about the room in loose groups. At one end, several smaller tables have been pushed together to form a large conference table. Although painted and furnished, the room still looks vaguely unfinished.

node.name: Ratha, Eastern Promenade
node.description: The travel-worn road narrows, and the caravans that frequent it tangle in the crowded way. Camels snort, donkeys bray and traders curse in the congestion as they all push for a place at the marble watering trough at the side of the road.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Shop
node.description: A blast of hellish heat greets every visitor who enters the simple wooden shack, and a thin layer of greyish soot covers every surface. The air hangs heavy with the acrid scent of melting steel. A sweating Dwarven attendant leans against the far wall, next to a heavy leather flap through which you can hear a muffled pounding noise.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Lobby
node.description: Faint traces of ash and glinting chips of metal add their interesting character to the stonework floor. The spartan airiness of this space almost overcomes the subtle scent of the working forge that pings and rattles at the other end of the hall, helped no doubt by a row of windows set just beneath the low ceiling.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Grinding Area
node.description: Within this somewhat insulated room, the pounding noises that reverberate throughout the forge are muted, replaced by the tooth-rattling shriek of a piece of metal being scoured by one of several grindstones. Arranged in a rough circle at the center of the room, the grindstones are attended by apprentice smiths in sooty aprons, who wander through periodically, bearing loads of heavy coal and iron.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Grinding Area
node.description: Within this somewhat insulated room, the pounding noises that reverberate throughout the forge are muted, replaced by the tooth-rattling shriek of a piece of metal being scoured by one of several grindstones. Arranged in a rough circle at the center of the room, the grindstones are attended by apprentice smiths in sooty aprons, who wander through periodically, bearing loads of heavy coal and iron.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Grinding Area
node.description: Within this somewhat insulated room, the pounding noises that reverberate throughout the forge are muted, replaced by the tooth-rattling shriek of a piece of metal being scoured by one of several grindstones. Arranged in a rough circle at the center of the room, the grindstones are attended by apprentice smiths in sooty aprons, who wander through periodically, bearing loads of heavy coal and iron.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Hallway
node.description: A narrow corridor stretches off from the lobby area, along a row of tiny heat-warped stalls. The echoing clang of metal on metal rings out from behind the curtained openings like peals of tinny thunder.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Foundry
node.description: The floor slopes toward a circular firepit fed by a large pile of crushed coal. A huge iron crucible hangs over the fire, suspended by heavy chains from a thick wooden beam. A leather bellows lies close at hand, while stone molds of various sizes and shapes, waiting to be filled, line the far wall.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Foundry
node.description: The floor slopes toward a circular firepit fed by a large pile of crushed coal. A huge iron crucible hangs over the fire, suspended by heavy chains from a thick wooden beam. A leather bellows lies close at hand, while stone molds of various sizes and shapes, waiting to be filled, line the far wall.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Foundry
node.description: The floor slopes toward a circular firepit fed by a large pile of crushed coal. A huge iron crucible hangs over the fire, suspended by heavy chains from a thick wooden beam. A leather bellows lies close at hand, while stone molds of various sizes and shapes, waiting to be filled, line the far wall.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Forge
node.description: A heavy iron anvil sits atop a piece of scorched, wet leather basking in the heat of the forge like a cat in the sun. Black burns on the leather tell the story of many a careless moment working the forge, and bring to mind frightening pictures of what happens when clumsiness brings the hot metal in contact with flesh.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Forge
node.description: A tiny breeze carries the grey smoke out through a small opening above, cutting though the oppressive heat with a hint of the wind outside. Despite the fresh air, the tight walls and low ceiling seem to press inward in the reddish glare from the forge that occupies one entire half of the stall, and the scent of burning metal assaults your sense of smell like acid burning into your brain.

node.name: Ss'ran's Forge, Forge
node.description: Heat beats against your skin in waves, rising from a bed of white-hot coals resting in a dilapidated forge against the far wall. The crimson glow outlines a squat iron anvil bolted to the middle of the floor against which metal is pounded and shaped.

node.name: Ratha, Eastern Promenade
node.description: At this crossroads, travelers can choose to enjoy the splendor of the Palace to the west and southeast, or head on through the banking district to the northeast. Guards stand rigid at their posts guarding the Palace grounds day and night. Government officials and financial experts make their way southeast to the Palace entrance and the tax collectors. To the west is the beginning of the grand Processional Way and the continuation of Promenade Way with its temples and shops.

node.name: Ratha, Ssivo's Migi Shagamat
node.description: This ostentatiously appointed shop is swathed in rich fabric and redolent with the aroma of rare spice. Suspended from the ceiling, extravagant draperies of heavy brocade hang in rich folds of gold-shot amethyst, amber and cinnabar, while low hassocks and divans provide seating. Underfoot, opulent jewel-toned carpets cushion your steps. Lamps of ornately pierced brass rest on tall stands at regular intervals about the room, their soft glow illuminating the contents of display cases and shelves.

node.name: Glythtide's Shrine
node.description: Herbs and roses grow in a tangle along a bordering, low stone wall. The shrine itself is built in the traditional Halfling style, as adapted to Ratha's rocky terrain. The squat stone structure resembles a small bump of a hill, and a bright blue door leading inside stands ajar. Three old island pines shelter and shade the shrine.

node.name: By Glythtide's Shrine, A Pine Path
node.description: Whispering boughs overhead sway softly, and dried needles underfoot rustle with each step. The path skirts the southern side of the small building dedicated to the god Glythtide.

node.name: Ratha, East Regents Circle
node.description: The stately Palace Drive meets Regents Circle in a celebration of wide plazas and decadent appointments. Tall brass standards bear baskets of hanging flowers and foliage while brass capped fences frame the perfect gardens of the palace to the west.

node.name: Ratha, East Palace Drive
node.description: Pilgrims and clergy alike mingle along this stretch of the drive. Temples are situated througout this section of Ratha and offer the reverent a peaceful refuge wherein to learn and worship.

node.name: Ratha, East Regents Circle
node.description: Imposing granite statuary can be seen all along the grand drive. One in particular, is that of a young S'kra Mur trader. Dressed in flowing robes and precious gems, he appears remarkably life-like, examining the crates on a waiting caravan.

node.name: Ratha, East Regents Circle
node.description: Ornate brass standards fly colorful penants, in tribute to local heroes who have brought honor to the city and province. Two massive S'kra guards glance about warily, alert to any sign of unwarranted entrance into the palace grounds.

node.name: A Pine Thicket
node.description: The scent of pine resin and decaying wood permeates this dark stand of trees. The sky is completely blocked from view by the overhanging boughs, and the air is still and suffocating. There is a sense of being watched, by something.

node.name: Urrem'tier's Path, Pine Grove
node.description: The air is still and muggy beneath the drooping limbs of tightly meshed pine boughs. Sounds deaden and echoes die at the approach to a shadowy doorway cut jaggedly into a jumble of black basalt boulders mounded as a solid mass as tall as the surrounding pine trees.

node.name: Truffenyi's Green, Eastern Fields
node.description: A large common green stretches out over most of the northeastern section of the tier. The grassy area is an excellent spot for athletic activities, for a meal on the soft grass, or contemplating the sky above. To the southeast a large circular fountain sprays water into the air with a hiss and soft patter of falling drops.

node.name: Truffenyi's Fountain
node.description: The grassy green surrounds a large, sparkling white marble fountain. At the fountain's center is a statue of the god Truffenyi, in mortal form, rendered by the carver as a strong muscular human warrior. The water arcs from the rim of the fountain and rains down from above on the statue which gazes patiently on the mortal world. Within the pool of the fountain are smaller carvings of the deity's aspects, the weasel and the magpie.

node.name: Chadatru's Temple, Forecourt
node.description: A row of columns frames the tall, broad temple building that rises ahead. This small courtyard consists of white pebbles, various aloe planted along the low walls, and a small altar placed against the western wall. A fountain above the altar spills fresh water over its surface, keeping the altar glistening in the bright light.

A row of columns frames the tall, broad temple building that rises ahead. Hundreds of burning candles rest on the low courtyard walls, illuminating this small forecourt and brightening the white pebbles underfoot. A fountain above the altar on the western wall spills fresh water over its surface, keeping the altar glistening softly in the candle light.

node.name: Chadatru's Temple, Great Hall
node.description: A smooth, red tile floor, the color of fresh blood, flows underfoot. A hewn statue of a lion stands amidst this apparent pool of life -- or death. The lion is carved in great detail from a creamy marble and stands over seven feet high and spans more than ten feet. The mane is tinged with dark streaks and its eye sockets are hollow, the eyes missing. A plaque rests in the floor at the lion's right front foot.

node.name: Ratha, East Regents Circle
node.description: From the well kept stone of the walkways, to the ornate iron fencing surrounding the lush gardens of the palace, the atmosphere is one of utter order and beauty. The amazing architecture of the palace itself is a joy to behold.

node.name: Ratha, Monument Square
node.description: Ivy covered iron fencing culminates in an elaborate gate that opens up onto a wide plaza.

node.name: Ratha, West Regents Circle
node.description: Roaming vendors are often seen along the expansive drive. Offerings such as rare teas and sugared pastries are among the delicacies enjoyed by all who stroll the luxurious circle. Birds and other small creatures often dart among the passersby, eager to covet a treasured ort.
The vendors have gone for the evening, the circle is now quiet. In the morning, they'll be back offering warm drinks and luscious treats to the privileged citizens who travel this route.

node.name: Ratha, West Regents Circle
node.description: Ornate brass standards fly colorful banners, each a different jewel tone, and embroidered with the crest of one of Ratha's ruling families. Two massive S'kra guards, replete in their official finery, stroll the walkway, monitoring entrance into the palace grounds.

The gardens are lit beyond the elaborate iron fencing, small brass lanterns ablaze along the pathways and courtyards. Two massive S'kra guards, replete in their offical finery patrol the circle all through the night, monitoring entrance into the palace grounds.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Grand Approach
node.description: The grand avenue that leads to the Palace is set with elaborate topiaries in the shape of mythical sea-creatures and stately coral formations. Even the path here glistens like the sea-bed. Well-manicured lawns sweep away to right and left, surrounding the edifice with a deep green carpet.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Avenue of the Heroes
node.description: Two lines of statues of famous personages and mythical heroes line a wide carriageway made of crushed stone. Each statue is twice life-size and formed with cunning skill, so that at any moment, they might step down off their pedestals and join the throngs around the palace.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Concourse
node.description: A sweeping carriage drive runs up to the very base of a magnificent stairway carved of white stone. Day and night, grooms stand ready to assist the nobility in alighting and caring for their horses, while sullen guards stand ready to deal with anyone who causes problems.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Portico
node.description: A wide, sweeping stair of gleaming white alabaster carries the eye from the grandeur of the Palace grounds to the equally imposing portico. Giant guards flank the doors, immobile as if cast from stone. The portico itself spreads across the front of the palace offering cool shade from the heat of the day. Several fountains spout from bronze grotesques set into the wall, their streams running down into stone basins where the traveler may quench a thirst or lave dusty feet.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Eastern Portico
node.description: Gazing out across the city towards the sunrise, the eastern portico offers an inspiring view to the early risers of the town. From time to time, services are held here to welcome the day. A low altar with a sunrise carved into the pale yellow stone is set here for that mission.

node.name: Sshoi-Sson Palace, West Portico
node.description: The western portico looks out across the city and ocean to the far horizon. When the weather is right, spectacular sunsets can be watched from the comfort of stone benches conveniently placed to enhance the view.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Grand Foyer
node.description: The roof rises far overhead to disappear in a glorious chandelier made of hundreds of rows of polished crystals in the shape of fanciful sea-creatures. The floor is a tesseract of cleverly interlocking tiles of sea-foam green stone alternating with pale alabaster shapes that together form endless rows of breaking waves. To one side, a hallway leads to the public offices accessible to everyone.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Public Library
node.description: Stained glass in the colors of the ocean is set into crescent-shaped windows high overhead. Bright light falls on the hushed rows of shelving holding fine matching leather-bound books with embossed gold lettering on the spines. Dark walnut tables with matching chairs provide places for readers to sit and spread out their research materials.

Hundreds of lamps and candles in bright brass candelabra illuminate stained glass windows in the colors of the ocean set into crescent-shaped windows high overhead. Bright light falls on the hushed rows of shelving holding fine matching leather-bound books with embossed gold lettering on the spines. Dark walnut tables with matching chairs provide places for readers to sit and spread out their research materials.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Provincial Bank Foyer
node.description: Understated elegance is the theme of this, the premier bank of the province. Carpet thicker than the bedding in many a cheap hostel muffles every sound. A golden light filters down from giant lamps set with stained-glass, while a gentle perfume scents the air. Deep banquettes, upholstered in richly embroidered fabrics provide a comfortable resting place for those waiting to conduct business.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Grand Provincial Bank, Bursarium
node.description: Quiet elegance is the theme here, that and the sort of luxury only huge piles of money can buy. Thick carpet, rare fireflame-patterned silverwood paneling, polished stone counters and trim emphasize the common theme of material wealth and lots of it. Elegantly liveried tellers quietly handle each transaction with a minimum of fuss and delay.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Public Hallway
node.description: Stark white walls and plain grey stone leech all feelings of warmth from the hallway. Unlike the grand ceremonial parts of the palace, this area is purely functional with no accommodation made for luxuries for the citizenry who must attend to legal matters here. Offices extend along the hall and are open to assist even those who keep late hours.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Public Hallway
node.description: The plain but serviceable decor extends along this part of the hallway with not so much as a picture on the wall to distract busy citizens as they go about their day. A hastily thrown-up barrier prevents further travel down the hall to the south, but the offices all seem open for business.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Debtor's Hall
node.description: There is a sense of repressed tension and anxiety in the air. For all the rich decor, this room seems cold and spare. A few people huddle along a hard narrow bench along the far wall. A circular counter surrounds several bored-looking clerks who seem to be engaged in almost any activity other than helping those pathetic few who approach them from time to time.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Narrow Corridor
node.description: Stark white walls and dull grey stone floor tiles suck any vestige of warmth from the very air. Grim-faced folk pass by in both directions, and from behind heavily barred doors comes the sound of clinking coins and the scratching sound of quill on parchment with the staccato clicking of an abacus adding a disjointed rhythm to the sounds, not unlike dry bones clacking in some bizarre parody of a dance.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Anteroom
node.description: This is quite obviously a waiting room for some high-ranked official's office. Dark wood paneling covers the the thick stone walls and the furniture, though sparse, is of heavy construction. A door set with brass studs leads into the inner sanctum while an iron-bound door that would do credit to a bank leads to the hallway outside.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Office of the Exchequer
node.description: Two features dominate the room: a massive safe big enough to hold a Gor'Tog and a desk easily large enough to serve as a small cottage for a pair of Halflings. The windowless room's only decor is a pair of silk hangings that depict banking scenes.

node.name: Office of Citizenry, Registration
node.description: An air of anticipation runs through this room as people shuffle their papers and tiredly smile to one another, a nice change from the cold reception outside these doors. A yawning clerk slowly waves everyone to the small, comfortable-looking couches lining the walls. Several sleepy patrons lounge about, nodding off from time to time as they wait their turn.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Genealogy Office
node.description: Sectioning off the room is a long counter, creating a secure space for the elderly clerk whose slow movements have been known to anger citizens in a hurry to get on their way. Mixing with the smell of old parchment is a lingering scent of stale tobacco coming from the direction of a cluttered, heavy desk tucked safely behind the barrier. Hung above a wooden bench in the waiting area is a painted sign, lending low budget decoration to the plastered walls.

node.name: Sshoi-sson Palace, Registry Records Office
node.description: Not much bigger than a closet, this stark white office is dominated by a government issued desk that is covered in neatly stacked papers. Secure filing cabinets line the back wall, leaving just enough room for the clerk on duty to move between them. The cramped waiting area intentionally lacks furniture, encouraging citizens to take care of business as quickly as possible and be on their way.

node.name: Ratha, West Regents Circle
node.description: Imposing granite statuary casts eerie shadows along the grand drive. The exquisite details so pronounced in the daylight are lost, as the inanimate sentinels loom larger than life in the half light.

node.name: Ratha, West Regents Circle
node.description: Handsome brick walkways round the corner from the spaciousness of Palace Drive to the formality of Regents Circle. Ornately wrought, iron balustrades are capped with gleaming brass and circumscribe the vast gardens that surround the palace. Perfectly matched and richly appointed, the accoutrements of the palace guards are no less formal, lending a sense of impending royalty to the area.

node.name: Ratha, Western Promenade
node.description: At this juncture, a traveler can choose to enjoy the splendor of the Palace to the southeast, or head on through the temple district to the northwest. Guards stand rigid at their posts guarding the Palace grounds day and night. Government officials make their way down to Regents Circle and the entrance to the Palace. To the east is the beginning of the grand Processional Way and the continuation of Promenade Way with its guilds and shops.

node.name: Ratha, Processional Way
node.description: The south end of the great Processional opens onto the Palace grounds where the trees spread their branches as if in greeting. They beckon one to take the pleasant stroll northward to the Great Waymeet and Angels Flights. Several stores and guilds can be found down the Promenade to the east. The west path leads off towards the temple grounds.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Foyer
node.description: The bright and airy Guild foyer is beautifully accented with plants and mosaic tilework. The floor is dominated by a large woven rug placed directly beneath a domed skylight. Wide marble steps allow access to the second story and a small archway leads to the guildleader's office.

The bright and airy Guild foyer is beautifully accented with plants and mosaic tilework. Several burning torches placed in wall sconces fill the room with a warm glow. The floor is dominated by a large woven rug placed directly beneath a domed skylight. Wide marble steps allow access to the second story and a small archway leads to the guildleader's office.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Eamonn's Office
node.description: A black marble desk flanked by two large platinum braziers sits directly in front of a large open window that overlooks the city. The vaulted four-paneled ceiling is decorated with beautiful images and deep green ivy overflows from gold-leaf planters in the corners of the room and winds its way up the adjacent marble columns.

A black marble desk, flanked by two brightly burning platinum braziers, sits directly in front of a large open window that overlooks the city. The vaulted four-paneled ceiling is decorated with beautiful images and deep green ivy overflows from gold-leaf planters in the corners of the room and winds its way up the adjacent marble columns.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Second Floor Landing
node.description: The landing provides access to the second floor rooms of the guild, as well as to the Grand Hall, via a circular staircase. A heavy bronze bound door leads to the Library, as indicated by the large word LIBRARY engraved on the bronze plate that has been mounted next to it.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Grand Hall of Light
node.description: Crowning the guild, this magnificent chamber of great breadth and height is filled with hundreds of brightly blazing candles and torches, flooding the room with light. This light shines through the glass windows which comprise the walls of this room, illuminating the guild throughout the entire city. White stone floors are dotted with various skin throws and accented with gold inlay around the edges. In the center of the room, a large round table is surrounded by several chairs and benches.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Observation Deck
node.description: Surrounded by a heavy stone balustrade, the tower commands a three hundred sixty degree view of Ratha and the sparkling sea beyond. A brass standard, supporting an ancient spyglass is mounted on a raised pedestal in the center of the floor.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Emporium
node.description: The smell of recently polished metal pervades the room. Along the painted walls are decorative shields and crests of various sizes and colors. A large granite counter sits in the middle of the room with hinged wood partitions on both sides.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Storage Room
node.description: At the bottom of the stone steps is a poorly lit narrow room filled with large wooden crates and boxes. Packing paper and straw are strewn haphazardly on the floor that is in dire need of sweeping. Hanging in the far corner of the room is a large lantern, lighting up a makeshift table that is covered with a variety of exotic wares.

node.name: Ratha, Processional Way
node.description: Onlookers from all over the realms gather here to enjoy the spectacle of the Palace as well as all the official activities taking place around the Palace itself. Even the trees seem to stand at attention, creating the atmosphere of great decorum. Most people rarely speak over a whisper here so as not to disturb the natural beauty and awesome ambiance of this glorious setting.

node.name: Ratha, Processional Way
node.description: During state events, this halfway point down the Processional is the perfect location from which to view the dignitaries and their entourages as they proceed grandly down the boulevard anticipating the great events to follow. The elegant temple gardens are visible through the ivy covered fence to the west.

node.name: Ratha, Processional Way
node.description: This is a perfect place to sit and savor the grand splendor of this great processional. Several benches, surrounded by small, delicate rose bushes giving off a heady, almost heavenly scent, abut the back fences of the temple grounds to the west and the bank to the east.

node.name: Ratha, Processional Way
node.description: The wide boulevard is impeccably maintained with clean, almost white cobblestones, bordered on each side with grassy walkways creating the feel of a small park. Nestled between the ivy covered fences lies a small white house.

node.name: Ratha, Processional Way
node.description: The soft sounds of water from the fountain to the north create a peaceful and comfortable atmosphere as you saunter down this grand boulevard. Lovely trees line the street almost creating an arch overhead and providing shelter from the elements, allowing a pleasant stroll at any hour of the day or night.

node.name: Ratha, The Great Waymeet
node.description: Many roads converge here, north of Processional Way, the great route leading to the palace. A large fountain rises at the center of the roads, and it serves as a gathering spot for all classes and races, a place where one can pause and enjoy the calming sounds of flowing waters and enjoy the marvelous aspect of the grand palace to the south.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: The road passes along the heavy, almost stolid flank of one of the city's many banks. High leaded windows, set with stout bars, show glimpses of an elegant ceiling within. City guards keep careful watch on the premises night and day.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: The stately entrance to the Imperial Palm Inn graces this stretch of roadway. Pink stone walls surround this haven of charm and taste, frequented by the better classes of Rathan society as well as the discerning traveler with the coins to match his taste.

node.name: Ratha, Golden Scale Road
node.description: The tall, cool walls of the Imperial Palm Inn rise along the north side of the road. Yards of shell-pink plaster cover the cold stone behind which twin towers, tiled in dark red, rise above the other lower buildings.

node.name: Ratha, Theater District
node.description: The red brick street runs eastward towards the prosperous theater which is one of the favorite entertainments of Ratha's upper class. Colorful lamps, strung from pole to pole and kept burning around the clock, line the road.

node.name: Ratha, Theater District
node.description: Made of bleached granite, the Hotagi'rath theater is a renovated temple of sweeping arches and architectural flair. Colorful pennants hang from every available outcrop on the building.

node.name: Ratha, Theater District
node.description: A large drainpipe, running up the side of the theater, connects to the roof's gutters. The pipes empty out into mildew stained rain barrels that are placed conveniently beneath.

node.name: Ratha, Theater District
node.description: The back of the theater looks to be in need of a bit of upkeep, with the bleached granite fading to its natural grey in many places. The street is cluttered with debris. Torn remnants of pennants, defaced by both the weather and vandals, hang on the building in need of replacement.

node.name: Ratha, Theater District
node.description: The brick street circles around the side of the Hotagi'rath theater. Flower beds skirt the building, with a blaze of color and scents. Benches amidst the small gardens provide a peaceful place to rest and contemplate.

node.name: Ratha, Narrow Alley
node.description: Littered with the forgotten remanent of former treasures, this brick pathway winds past some of the more fashionable parts of town. Light flickers from lanterns above unmarked doorways as it battles against the darkness that forces it to remain a mere pool of warmth at the doorsteps. Ominous shadows seem to lurk within every nook from the depth of the cold night.

node.name: Ratha, Narrow Alley
node.description: The sounds of the city are muffled from the high walls that parallel the alleyway. A sense of movement and soft whispers are imagined from deep within the dark shadows. Warm light from the windows above fail to win over the powers of the night to illuminate the alley.

node.name: Ratha, Narrow Alley
node.description: Weak pale blades of grass and weeds fight to break through portions of the red brick that have become cracked and broken along the alley's path. Formerly a soft pink color, the granite walls have become faded to a grayish-pink from rain and lack of care.

node.name: Ratha, Narrow Alley
node.description: The walls close in upon the alley rendering dark foreboding shadows even at the peak of the day. Empty barrels and crates choke the passage to a mere trail through a forest of debris and refuse. A small pool of muddy and scum covered water has become the final resting spot for the drainage of a broken gutter above. Slow thick concentric ripples slowly radiate outward from the center of the pond with each drip of water.

node.name: Ratha, Narrow Alley
node.description: Years of neglect have rended this former bricked alley to a rutted dirt path with scattered embedded shards of broken brick. Stacks of broken crates lean precariously against a rain streaked granite wall. A couple of cracked stone steps lead down to a shadowed alcove.

node.name: Narrow Alley, Alcove
node.description: An unmarked door is set within this dark alcove along the grey granite wall. To the left of the door, a small dingy window hints of a brightly colored curtain on the inside. A set of stone steps lead back up to the alley.

node.name: Ratha, Angels' Flight
node.description: A silver-trimmed lift carries its loads with quiet elegance. Even the chains have been tinted a silver color in keeping with the many elegant personages who choose to ride it.

node.name: Ratha, Angels' Flight
node.description: A gold-trimmed lift carries its loads with quiet elegance. Even the chains have been tinted a gold color in keeping with the high-ranking passengers who ride it.

node.name: Ratha, Western Promenade
node.description: Travelers move quickly along the weathered cobblestone road which bridges the palace district and the temple district. The lush greenery and trees found to the north and east fall back to a more open-air route of grass and small bushes. An occasional glimpse of the elegant temple gardens to the north is possible through the ivy covered fences. A large, ornate ironwork facade decorated with the image of a panther marks the entrance to Damaris' Temple.

node.name: Ratha, Western Promenade
node.description: A favorite place for the clergy to gather, this section of the Promenade widens on the north side where it encroaches onto the temple grounds and provides a beautiful garden setting to sit and relax along one's journey, or to just find some quiet place for personal meditation. Several small statues of local deities line the fence as if to bless those who pass.

node.name: Ratha, Western Promenade
node.description: Promenade Way opens to the east where it skirts the southern border of the Temple district and provides easy access for commoners, the elite and the clergy. Well traveled by foot, as well as caravan, the cobblestone street is replete with ruts and holes desperately in need of repair. The grass along the fenced edges, however, is well maintained and allows for easy foot access to the temple grounds to the east and north.

node.name: Ratha, Greensward Lane
node.description: A small, red tile-roofed shop sits deep within the shadows of a nearby grove of small trees. A curious air pervades the tiny store, as if there were unseen comings and goings on some higher plane than normal senses could perceive.

A miniscule red tile-roofed shop sits alongside a small patch of greenery in this stone-bound city. A curious sense of withdrawal surrounds the otherwise mundane little building, as if it were somehow removed from the ordinary world about it.

node.name: Ratha, Greensward Lane
node.description: A few straggly patches of grass seem to be the only reason for the somewhat pompous name given to this patch of road. Rough gravel strangles the grass and what little grows here is scraggly and drear. Somewhere though, the cheerful sound of birdsong resonates and there is just the faintest whiff of true greenery.

node.name: Ratha, Z'hutoya Way
node.description: Fluted stone towers rise towards the heavens, their surfaces engraved with images of twining snakes. On the northern side of the street, a large wooden gate is bracketed by two defensive towers. Engraved on the gate is the crest of the Warrior Mage Guild.

node.name: Ratha, Bitter Angle Road
node.description: Tucked between the pretentious facade of the Warrior Mage Guild and the great Waymeet, this tiny angle of road holds little charm. Throngs of people hurry this way and that, regardless of the hour, ready to trample the idler. Meanwhile, horse- and mule-borne cargoes stand poised to crush the less agile or those who may take a moment to pause and observe the rush of daily life.

node.name: Ratha, West Palace Drive
node.description: The drive is hushed now, as the business of the day is left behind in exchange for the peace of the evening hours. Pilgrims are often seen huddled in groups just off the drive, silent and seeking warmth as they wait for the dawn of a new day and the missions they've come to complete.

In hushed reverence, pilgrims make their way down the beautiful avenue toward temples and shrines to their various deities. Here to repent for sins untold, or seek the teaching of a great master, they come from all corners of Elanthia. Just ahead, the great palace towers above Regents Circle and the lush gardens beyond.

node.name: Ratha, West Palace Drive
node.description: Great iron poles line the drive on either side, supporting brightly glowing lanterns. The stately carriages and regal equines that traverse the drive during the day are now tucked safely into their stalls as even Ratha's royalty sleeps the night away.

Great iron poles line the drive on either side, supporting colorful banners with royal insignias and coats of arms that wave in the constant breeze. Great stately carriages, pulled by perfectly matched equines, regularly make their way to and from the palace. Through the fencing, children peer expectantly, waiting for a glimpse of some visiting dignitary or member of Ratha's ruling class.

node.name: Ratha, West Palace Drive
node.description: Wide and expansive, this elegant drive parades east toward Regents Circle and the magnificent Ratha Palace beyond. Down the center of the avenue, a lantern lined median channels carriage traffic east and west in an orderly flow. All along the regal boulevard, handsome wrought-iron fencing and sculptured topiaries create a formal garden-like atmosphere, as administrators and clergy mingle with Ratha's upper class citizenry along the wide plazas on either side of the street.

Wide and expansive, this elegant drive parades east toward Regents Circle and the magnificent Ratha Palace beyond. Down the center of the avenue, a tree lined median channels carriage traffic east and west in an orderly flow. All along the regal boulevard, handsome wrought-iron fencing and sculptured topiaries create a formal garden-like atmosphere, as administrators and clergy mingle with Ratha's upper class citizenry along the wide plazas on either side of the street.

node.name: Everild's Temple, Outside
node.description: A simple building is designated as the temple to Everild by the threshold stone at the entrance. Two carvings stand guard at the doorway, one of a centaur, the other of a wolverine.

node.name: Ratha, Oakbow Road
node.description: Temples to the gods meet temples to paperwork where the districts of each coalesce. Three roads converge in a small crossing among the stone and wooden buildings. Far off, the sound of the sea echoes dimly and the bell of some ship rings faintly as it rocks at anchor.

Temples to the gods meet temples to paperwork where the districts of each coalesce. Three roads converge in a small crossing among the stone and wooden buildings. To one side, an enterprising scribe has set a portable desk where she sits cross-legged, writing letters and drawing up contracts and various papers for those who have such need.

node.name: Ratha, Oakbow Road
node.description: Government offices rise cheek by jowl, poking out above the road as their teetering upper stories lean toward each other for mutual support. Somewhere nearby can be heard the heavy clanking of lift chains as uniformed couriers race by, each carrying some tiny bit of paper to add the ever-growing piles needed by any bureaucracy.

node.name: Ratha, Oakbow Road
node.description: The great oaken lift wends its way up and down, hauling people and cargo all the hours of the day and night. Being closest to the government quarter, all manner of petty officials, couriers, hangers-on and an endless stream of petitioners make their way here, each wrapped in his or her concerns and heedless of the bustle all about.

node.name: Ratha, Guardian Naga Way
node.description: A narrow alley runs among the temples, providing service access for deliveries and such. Even the gods need their trash hauled, it would seem. Rats and such skitter amongst small piles of debris while rag-clad scavengers of the two-legged sort pick over scraps of food and stubs of candles that can be resold in the lower tiers.

node.name: Ratha, Guardian Naga Way
node.description: A small patch of open land among the drab backsides of nearby buildings offers a welcome bit of space. A few straggly plants have found a way through the hard-packed, rocky soil, their tattered leaves making curious shadows against the darker background.

A small patch of open space among the drab backsides of nearby buildings offers a welcome bit of sun. A few straggly plants have forced their way through the hard-packed, rocky soil and several bear oddly bright flowers among the grey stone and drab earth.

node.name: Ratha, Guardian Naga Way
node.description: A rare bit of open land among the crowded tiers, this patch of sandy soil has been taken over by someone trying to grow herbs and such. The ground is hard and rocky, the crop sparse and the return poor. However, for some it may mean the difference between poverty and starvation on the one hand, and survival on the other.

node.name: Ratha, Guardian Naga Way
node.description: A few torches glimmer from a small park nearby. The scent of growing foliage is rich in the moist sea air, a welcome change from the dusty air in the more crowded sections of town.
The path winds across a sandy patch of space past a startlingly green oasis in this rocky city. A few people stroll about, enjoying the breeze and the scent of the nearby greenery.

node.name: Ratha, Greensward Lane
node.description: From a small garden surrounding a curiously-shaped building comes the muted song of many birds. A pleasant change from the omnipresent cry of gulls, it has a strangely soothing effect. Cares and troubles seem to fade and a warm sense of security and warmth pervades the air.

node.name: A Winding Path
node.description: A narrow path begins a winding descent from the streets down the western cliffs of the city. Saltbrush and stiff grasses block the view to the south and the climb down takes some careful foot-placing. The main avenues of the city lie further to the east.

node.name: A Winding Path
node.description: Below a steep section of the cliff, the path winds around some large bushes that glisten palely with white salt crystals on their thick leaves. The city lies upwards over the cliff rocks, which rain a splattering of loose gravel with every movement over them.

node.name: A Winding Path
node.description: A slick, steep incline of shale is slippery with sand that has blown across the path, though a break of bushes gives some handholds for steadying. A clatter of rocks from above frightens a rabbit hiding beneath the brush.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, Approach
node.description: A tall, dark wooden building lies ahead through an avenue of cedars. The approach is a mown grassy field bordered with white Ratha cliff thistles. The wind blows through the trees, creating a rush of soft sound.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, North Entrance
node.description: A six-tiered temple, still under construction, faces the bay to the south. Made of wood, instead of stone, it resembles a large sailing ship, with its wooden timbers and tall crow's nest perched high above. Each dormer of the roof holds a carved wooden raven, wings outspread, that appears to both guard the entrances and to catch the ocean winds and nearly bear the whole structure aloft. The flag of the Nadamian family flaps briskly from the the highest mast.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, East Entrance
node.description: A six-tiered temple, still under construction, faces the bay to the south. Made of wood, instead of stone, it resembles a large sailing ship, with its wooden timbers and tall crow's nest perched high above. Each dormer of the roof holds a carved wooden raven, wings outspread, that appears to both guard the entrances and to catch the ocean winds and nearly bear the whole structure aloft. The flag of the Nadamian family flaps briskly from the the highest mast.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, West Entrance
node.description: A six-tiered temple, still under construction, faces the bay to the south. Made of wood, instead of stone, it resembles a large sailing ship, with its wooden timbers and tall crow's nest perched high above. Each dormer of the roof holds a carved wooden raven, wings outspread, that appears to both guard the entrances and to catch the ocean winds and nearly bear the whole structure aloft. The flag of the Nadamian family flaps briskly from the the highest mast.

node.name: Faenella's Shrine, A Small Park
node.description: A wooded area shielded by a hedge of firethorn shrubs surrounds a tall barrel-shaped building. A bench huddles beneath a low bough of a small tree heavily laden with bright red berries. Many different kinds of songbirds flutter through the dense shrubs, snatching from the tree's feast.

node.name: Faenella's Temple, Sanctum
node.description: Smooth, dark wooden walls curve around this tall narrow room. The only window is a skylight above a pale statue of Faenella, sculpted kneeling before a basin of water placed in the center of the space. One half of the room is strung with golden wires that run from the floor to the ceiling, and sound in the chamber vibrates them to a pleasing tone.

Smooth, dark wooden walls curve around this tall narrow room. A skylight from above brightens the pale statue of Faenella kneeling before a basin of water placed in the center of the space. One half of the room is strung with golden wires that run from the floor to ceiling, and sound in the chamber vibrates them to a pleasing tone.

node.name: Faenella's Temple, Priest's Quarters
node.description: This cluttered room is filled with rolls of sheet music and instruments. A S'Kra Mur priest, his black scales painted with silver wrens, sits beside a large harp, humming a hymn to his goddess.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, West Transept
node.description: The ceiling of the west transept is painted with the image of a young Dwarf holding a mining hammer and discovering a large vein of silver ore. A silver-plated door leads out of the temple. Lanterns of polished silver hang from the walls which are painted with other scenes from the long life of Tarteran Nadamian.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, Center
node.description: The center of the temple allows a good view of the galleries above and the timbered ceiling. Painters have not completed the ceiling artwork, but the basic outlines of a large raven in flight is roughly painted in.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, Interior
node.description: Here at the northern end of the temple, an aisle stretches forward to the altar at the south. Every inch of the wooden walls is covered with painted images of the history of the island and the various representations of the aspects of the gods in their role in the universe. Wooden columns support narrow galleries above and clerestory windows of leaded glass reflect candle light to a frosty white.

Here at the northern end of the temple, an aisle stretches forward to the altar at the south. Every inch of the wooden walls is covered with painted images of the history of the island and the various representations of the aspects of the gods in their role in the universe. Wooden columns support narrow galleries above and clerestory windows of leaded glass filter light to flood the temple.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, Apse
node.description: Although there are no pews for worshippers to rest on, here at the front of the temple are several long wooden benches. A curved railing shaped much like the bow of a ship encloses the altar, protecting and framing it splendidly.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, East Transept
node.description: The ceiling of the east transept is painted with an eternal battle. A small welkin, the symbol of Divyaush struggles with a raving raccoon, the manisfestation of Zachriedek. A stormy sea scene frames their conflict, as waves of foam-crested spume fling up the walls toward the supporting ceiling beams.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, Winding Stair
node.description: Filigree iron stairs spiral around a large wooden pole reminsicent of a ship's mast. A polished deobar railing is carved with images of ravens and raccoons which intertwine around anchors, mining picks and the crest of the Nadamian family. Dark aged oak carved into the shape of a leaping welkin forms the newel post to anchor the railing to the steps at the bottom and top of each section.

node.name: Kertigen's Temple, Meditation Chamber
node.description: The pinpoint brilliance of a candle flame is the only light within the chamber. Rustling movements and whispered chants are the only sounds to fill the blackness. A flight of wooden steps leads to the main section of temple above.

node.name: A Sandy Pathway
node.description: This pathway leads off towards the western cliffs and the sea beyond, and back towards the main streets of the city. Sandlilies line the trail, their deep blue blossoms waving in the fresh sea air. A gull cries in the distance, and the wind puffs in drafts blowing the sand in little clouds.

node.name: Eluned's Temple, Pathway
node.description: The path ends at a low building made of sandstone bricks, and the cliffs behind it fall off to the western sea below. The temple's gently-sloping roof is made of slate tiles arranged in a fish-scale pattern. A triangular-arched doorway, just tall enough for the tallest mortal to enter is capped with a splendid carving of a life-sized albatross. Steps inside the doorway lead down into a cool, dark passageway.

node.name: Fish Seller's Hut, Interior
node.description: The small hut smells overwhelmingly of fish. Stinks might even be a better description. A young lean S'Kra Mur fellow leans against a large barrel full of water and small silvery fish.

node.name: Eluned's Temple, Entry Hall
node.description: The limestone floor, inset with various shells to create a mosaic border with images of cresting waves and swirling currents, is an unusual feature of this entry hall. The walls are painted with elaborate murals of the sea, each a vision of a calm, clear ocean. Nothing suggestive of disaster or misfortune exists here.

node.name: Eluned's Temple, Devotion Pool
node.description: The main portion of the temple is a large pool surrounded by a border of smooth raked sand. On the western wall, a waterfall tumbles merrily into the pool and splashes clear water that foams and froths gently on the surface.

node.name: Eluned's Temple, Pool
node.description: The water is cold and salty, and deep. The waterfall gently froths the water and lulls with a rhythmic splashing sound.

node.name: Eluned's Temple, Pool
node.description: Some light filters down from above, but beneath the water looks dark and deep. What may lurk there is anyone's guess.

node.name: Everild's Temple, Interior
node.description: This circular temple contains one mammoth-sized boulder with a small cave hollowed on one side. A boar statue rests inside the cave, with one eye open, watching.

node.name: Everild's Temple, Inside the Cave
node.description: The small cave provides a rustic setting for the boar statue, which is made of cold bronze. Although poised as if sleeping, its body is tense and a single open eye appears to watch every movement.

node.name: Damaris' Temple, Altar Hall
node.description: A long narrow hall focuses attention on an altar at the western end. The only ornament is the floor, an image of an elongated panther created from black marble floor tiles set against white shimmering stone. The paws of the panther embrace the altar, and its tail curves around to the door leading outside the temple.

node.name: Damaris' Temple, Dream Hall
node.description: Three walls of the inner sanctum are hung with soft, black velvet drapes that muffle sound and still the air. A silver floor reflects soft images of worshipers like a wavering mirror. A rectangular shallow pool covers half the area, the silvery bottom sparkling beneath the water's ripples. Black silk pillows are placed in perfect symmetry at the edge of the pool, facing the fourth blank, black wall.

node.name: Kalazashi's House of Majik
node.note: Kalazashi's House of Majik|magic shop|Majik Shop
node.description: The darkened shop is lit by a pair of oil lamps which sit upon a mahogany counter. Their light does little to dispel the gloom of the interior, but seems instead merely to accentuate the shadows which gather in the corners. Rare gems, precious metals, chunks of cambrinth and runestones all mingle in an unorganized pile on the tray beside the shopkeeper, near at hand as he works to create the magical jewelry for which the shop is known.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Courtyard
node.description: Dark grey cobblestones line the earth between the imposing stone walls of the courtyard. Bracketed by defensive towers, a large wooden gate leads out into Ratha's third tier. Opposite the gate, columns of carved ivory flank an ebonwood door which leads into the guildhall.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Salle
node.description: White oak floorboards and walls are scarred by generations of weapons practice. Several wooden dummies are spaced about the floor, targets for novices to test their skills against. A stone ramp towards the back of the salle leads deeper into the Guildhall.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Testing Chamber
node.description: This long hallway within the courtyard walls is filled with people working on various ways to increase their stamina for combat. A ladder at the far end of the hall leads up to one of the defensive towers.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Tower
node.description: The opulent beauty of Z'hutoya Way lies spread out below. The northern guard tower is manned by a S'Kra sentry who never takes her eyes off of the street's occupants. A curved snrhhti horn hangs from a nail in the tower's roof, its surface engraved with ancient sigils.

node.name: Svra'an's Fine Jewelry
node.description: A glass display case lined with deep blue velvet runs the length of the room. Carefully arranged on the velvet are precious gems and metals fashioned by the skill of the gemsmith into delicate circlets, sparkling rings and polished ru'at bracelets. On top of the case, a tooled leather catalog embossed in gold lists the various items offered for sale.

node.name: Hotagi'rath Theater, Lobby
node.description: Tall, fluted columns are spaced along each wall, framing carved niches hung with copper lanterns that keep the lobby brightly lit at all hours. Breaking up the long expanse of pale stone, an artfully draped crimson curtain adds a dramatic background to the small refreshment stand, which tempts theater-goers during intermission with an aroma of ale and hot popped corn. Greeting patrons as they enter the building, a decorative marquee hangs near the door waiting to announce the next performance.

node.name: Hotagi'rath Theater, Performance Hall
node.description: Long, tiered rows of cushioned benches cascade down to surround the stage in a semicircle, designed so that patrons from all walks of life will have a good view. Softly glowing lamps are positioned low on the walls, allowing them to be easily shaded into total darkness during a performance so that sounds from the brightly lit stage seem to magnify outward like magic. One aisle, surrounded by a red velvet rope, leads to a staircase accentuated by an arch that is decorated with a large, golden lyre.

node.name: Hotagi'rath Theater, Hallway
node.description: Littered with a few discarded playbills, the long, darkened hallway continues towards the rear of the theater. Yards of heavy fabric do little to muffle the jumble of melodies periodically drifting from a curtained arch, drawing the attention of performers as they pass by it on their way to the brightly lit backstage door. Hung low on one wall is a nondescript service vent used by in-house staff during their daily routine of caring for the building.

node.name: Hotagi'rath Theater, Rehearsal Hall
node.description: Heavily quilted pads strategically blanket each wall, aiding the area's overall acoustics and muting from the rest of the theater any disruptive off-key notes created by practicing musicians. Donated by the Rathan High Council of Nine to encourage fledgling talents, a walnut harpsichord facing a padded bench, an ebonwood cello leaning against a straight-backed chair and some tall island drums hiding a bamboo stool are situated in front of shelves stacked with replacement tools needed to play them.

node.name: Hotagi'rath Theater, Backstage
node.description: Always being prepared for the next rehearsal or performance, this room constantly bustles with activity as performers, stagehands, scenery designers, prop handlers, costumers, wig and make-up artists rush to and fro, each with their own agenda. Benches await those times when directors call everything to a halt for a meeting to track their production's progress. Hung near the backstage door, a shelf is provided for those wishing to donate props to less fortunate entertainers in the chorus.

node.name: Hotagi'rath Theater, Dressing Room
node.description: On each side of the room, wooden partitions form individual cubicles complete with privacy curtains, allowing featured male and female performers to be attended to by their own assistants while collecting their thoughts before curtain call. Bit players are relegated to the far wall where a mirror stands ready above the long counter cluttered with makeup cases and various other accessories that may be needed. Tall chairs await entertainers to take a seat as dressers and hairdressers work their magic.

node.name: Hotagi'rath Theater, Wings
node.description: Dark curtains obscure the performer's view of the audience while still allowing them a clear-cut view of the stage as they practice their lines or wait for cues during rehearsals and performances. Carpenters, painters, builders and designers work off to one side making sure that scenery, set decor, tableaus and backdrops are maintained. A metal door keeps out those who would disrupt productions by climbing a flimsy ladder leading up to the catwalk or running down the stairs to the orchestra pit.

node.name: Hotagi'rath Theater, Stage
